Johann Sebastian Bach

Works not in the Schmieder catalogue

This page gives nine pieces attributed to Bach, all possibly spurious, that are in no versions of the Schmieder catalogue.

Recommended editions

  • Neue Bach-Ausgabe (Bärenreiter) · V, 12 · BA 5296-01 · Werke zweifelhafter Echtheit für Tasteninstrumente · ed. Ulrich Bartels / Frieder Rempp [nos. 1–5]
  • Bärenreiter · BA 5250 · Werke zweifelhafter Echtheit für Tasteninstrumente · ed. Ulrich Bartels / Frieder Rempp [nos. 1–5]
  • Bärenreiter · BA 5249 · J. S. Bach zugeschriebene Werke für Tasteninstrumente · ed. Frieder Rempp [nos. 6–9]
  • Peters · EP 11503 · Clavier-Büchlein für Johann Christian Bach · ed. Christoph Wolff [no. 1]

1. Polonaise in D minor

This is an arrangement of the polonaise from the orchestral suite no. 2 in B minor (BWV 1067).

Duration: 1'

Difficulty: 1

2. Fughetta in D minor

Duration: 1'

Difficulty: 1.5

3. Prelude in G minor

Duration: 4'

Difficulty: 2.5

4. Menuet and Trio in A minor

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 1

5. Fantasia in B minor

Duration: 1'

Difficulty: 2

6. Fugue in C major

This fugue includes a part for pedal, but can still be played effectively, albeit with some awkwardness, on an instrument without pedals.

Duration: 2' 30"

Difficulty: 3

7. Fugue in C minor

This fugue includes a part for pedal, but can still be played effectively on an instrument without pedals.

Duration: 3' 30"

Difficulty: 3

8. Fugue in B minor

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 3

9. Fugue in C minor

Duration: 5'

Difficulty: 3.5
